title: Verify Prenatal Insurance
description: Call insurer to confirm coverage details for prenatal visits, ultrasounds, and delivery. Ask about deductible and out-of-pocket maximums.

title: Schedule Nuchal Translucency
description: Book the NT scan (screening for chromosomal abnormalities) which must occur between weeks 11 and 14.

title: Select OB-GYN/Midwife
description: Research and select a provider. Confirm they have privileges at your desired delivery hospital or birth center.

title: Research Pediatricians
description: Compile a list of in-network pediatricians. Check reviews and schedule "meet-and-greet" interviews if offered.

title: Daycare Waitlist Application
description: Identify top 3 daycare centers. Submit deposits and applications immediately as waitlists can exceed 12 months.

title: FSA/HSA Contribution Review
description: Review pre-tax health savings accounts. Maximize contributions for upcoming hospital bills and dependent care.

title: Employer Leave Policy Review
description: Request FMLA and Paid Parental Leave handbooks from HR. Determine eligibility and notification deadlines.

title: Genetic Screening Decision
description: Discuss with OB-GYN whether to proceed with NIPT (Non-Invasive Prenatal Testing) or carrier screening.

title: 20-Week Anatomy Scan
description: Attend the mid-pregnancy ultrasound to check fetal organ development and measurements.

title: Dental Cleaning (Mom)
description: Schedule a cleaning. Hormonal changes increase risk of pregnancy gingivitis, which is linked to preterm birth.

title: Create Baby Registry
description: Begin selecting gear. Focus on needs vs. wants to guide shower gifts and personal budgeting.

title: Budget Planning: Post-Baby
description: Create a pro-forma monthly budget including estimated diaper, formula, and childcare costs.

title: Glucose Screening Test
description: Complete the 1-hour glucose challenge test to screen for gestational diabetes (standard at 24-28 weeks).

title: Nursery Room Clearance
description: Clear the designated nursery room of existing furniture/clutter to prepare for painting and setup.

title: Research Cord Blood Banking
description: Decide whether to bank cord blood privately, donate to a public bank, or discard. Order kit if banking.

title: Purchase Crib
description: Buy a crib that meets current CPSC safety standards (no drop sides). Measure room to ensure fit.

title: Buy Firm Crib Mattress
description: Purchase a specifically firm infant mattress. Perform the "two-finger test" to ensure snug fit in crib frame.

title: Research Doula Support
description: Decide if a birth doula is desired for labor support. Interview and hire if applicable.

title: Maternity Wardrobe Audit
description: Purchase essential maternity clothes (jeans, leggings, tops) as regular clothes become restrictive.

title: Plan Babymoon
description: Schedule a final trip or weekend away before travel becomes restricted in the third trimester.

title: Life Insurance Audit
description: Review existing life insurance policies. Determine if coverage needs increasing to protect the new dependent.

title: Update Beneficiaries
description: Check 401k/IRA beneficiary designations. Plan to add child as contingent beneficiary post-birth.

title: Pet Behavioral Prep
description: Begin training pets to respect nursery boundaries and baby sounds (play recordings of crying).

title: Purchase Glider/Rocker
description: Select a comfortable chair for nursing/feeding. Test for back support and ease of standing up.

title: Nursery Painting
description: Paint nursery early to allow VOCs/fumes to dissipate well before baby arrives.

title: TDAP Vaccine (Mom)
description: Receive Tdap booster (27-36 weeks) to pass whooping cough antibodies to the fetus.

title: TDAP Vaccine (Dad/Partners)
description: Dad and close caregivers get Tdap booster to create a "cocoon" of immunity around the newborn.

title: Flu Shot (Family)
description: If in season, all household members should receive the influenza vaccine.

title: Install Infant Car Seat
description: Install car seat base in primary vehicle using LATCH or seatbelt. Ensure level indicator is correct.

title: Car Seat Inspection
description: Visit a certified Child Passenger Safety Technician (CPST) to verify installation angle and tightness.

title: Pack Hospital Bag (Mom)
description: Pack nursing bras, robe, comfortable clothes, toiletries, heavy flow pads, ID, and insurance card.

title: Pack Hospital Bag (Dad)
description: Pack snacks, hydration, change of clothes, pillow/blanket, chargers, and entertainment.

title: Purchase Postpartum Care Kit
description: Buy peri-bottle, witch hazel pads, sitz bath soak, and maxi pads for recovery.

title: Wash Baby Clothes
description: Wash all newborn and 0-3 month clothes/sheets in fragrance-free, hypoallergenic detergent.

title: Breast Pump Acquisition
description: Order breast pump through insurance (often free). Sterilize parts upon arrival.

title: Bottle Sterilization
description: Sterilize a starter set of bottles and nipples (boil or steam) even if breastfeeding, for emergencies.

title: Purchase Formula (Emergency)
description: Buy 1-2 containers of ready-to-feed newborn formula as a backup supply.

title: Pediatrician Registration
description: Confirm the selected pediatrician is accepting new patients and note their after-hours line.

title: Hospital Pre-Registration
description: Complete all admission paperwork online to avoid administrative delays during active labor.

title: Create Birth Plan
description: Draft preferences for pain management, labor movement, and immediate newborn procedures (e.g., Vitamin K).

title: Deep Clean House
description: Perform or hire a deep clean (floors, bathrooms, dusting) to prepare a sanitary environment.

title: Stock Freezer Meals
description: Cook or buy 14 days worth of freezeable dinners to reduce cooking load postpartum.

title: Purchase Diapers/Wipes
description: Stock 1 box of Newborn and 1 box of Size 1 diapers, plus 4 packs of unscented wipes.

title: Setup Safe Sleep Space
description: Ensure crib/bassinet is free of bumpers, blankets, pillows, and toys (AAP Safe Sleep guidelines).

title: Plan Hospital Route
description: Map the primary and secondary routes to the hospital. Practice the drive if anxious about traffic.

title: Arrange Pet Care
description: Confirm who will care for pets during the hospital stay. Provide keys and feeding instructions.

title: Arrange Sibling Care
description: If applicable, confirm who will watch older children during labor/delivery.

title: Sibling Gift Purchase
description: Buy a gift "from the baby" to give to the older sibling upon meeting to foster positive association.

title: Install Baby Monitor
description: Set up camera and parent unit. Test connectivity and audio levels.

title: Assemble Baby Gear
description: Assemble swing, bouncer, and stroller. Ensure batteries are installed if needed.

title: Purchase Nursing Supplies
description: Buy nursing pads, nipple cream (lanolin), and nursing pillow.

title: Work Hand-off Plan
description: Finalize transition documents for colleagues. Set Out-of-Office email response.

title: Charge Electronics
description: Ensure camera batteries, power banks, and portable speakers are fully charged.

title: Final Grocery Run
description: Stock fridge with perishables, snacks, and hydration drinks for early labor/postpartum.

title: Download Contraction App
description: Install a contraction timer app on Dad's phone to track labor progression.

title: Birth Certificate Worksheet
description: Complete the official worksheet at the hospital. Verify exact spelling of full names.

title: Request Social Security #
description: Check the box on the birth certificate worksheet to auto-request the SSN card.

title: Sign Paternity Affidavit
description: (If unmarried) Complete legal paternity acknowledgment forms at the hospital.

title: Add Baby to Insurance
description: Contact HR/Insurer to add baby. "Qualifying Life Event" window is strictly 30 days.

title: Schedule First Ped Visit
description: Call from hospital to book the first checkup (usually 2-5 days after discharge).

title: Hospital Discharge Plan
description: Review discharge instructions. Ensure all prescriptions (pain relief/stool softeners) are filled.

title: Attend 1st Pediatrician Visit
description: Bring hospital discharge papers. Check weight and bilirubin levels.

title: Order Birth Certificates
description: Request 3-5 certified copies from County/State Vital Records. Needed for passport/school.

title: File PFL/FMLA Claims
description: Submit final forms for state/employer paid leave benefits to ensure income continuity.

title: Write Thank You Notes
description: Begin writing thank yous for gifts. Do 1-2 per day to manage volume.

title: Newborn Photo Shoot
description: If desired, schedule newborn photography (best done in first 2 weeks).

title: Lactation Consultant
description: Schedule appointment if breastfeeding is painful or weight gain is slow.

title: Vitamin D Drops
description: Start administering 400 IU Vitamin D daily if exclusively breastfeeding (AAP guideline).

title: Tummy Time Initiation
description: Begin short (1-2 min) sessions 2-3 times a day to strengthen neck muscles.

title: Assess Flat Head
description: Monitor head shape. Rotate head position during sleep to prevent plagiocephaly.

title: Update W-4
description: Adjust tax withholding with employer to account for new dependent (Child Tax Credit).

title: Open 529 College Plan
description: Open account once SSN arrives. Share contribution link with family.

title: Update Estate Plan
description: Amend Will/Trust to name a legal guardian for the child. Essential for asset protection.

title: Life Insurance Review
description: Purchase/increase term life insurance to cover child's expenses to adulthood.

title: Freeze Child's Credit
description: Contact Equifax, Experian, TransUnion to freeze child's file and prevent identity theft.

title: Create Child's Email
description: Register firstname.lastname@gmail.com to reserve digital identity.

title: Bottle Nipple Transition
description: Check if baby needs faster flow nipple (Level 1 to 2) if feeding takes >20 mins.

title: Check Pacifier Size
description: Upgrade pacifiers to 3m+ size for safety (larger shield prevents choking).

title: Schedule 2-Month Shots
description: Book well-baby visit for first major round of vaccinations (DTaP, Hib, Polio, etc.).

title: Postpartum Checkup
description: Attend 6-week checkup for Mom (healing, mental health, contraception).

title: Pelvic Floor Therapy
description: Assess need for rehabilitation therapy post-birth. Schedule evaluation.

title: Return to Work Plan
description: Confirm start date with employer. Arrange trial run of morning routine.

title: Daycare Transition
description: Begin transition days (partial hours) to acclimate baby to childcare provider.

title: Prepare Bottle Labels
description: Label all bottles/milk bags for daycare with name and date (licensing requirement).

title: Milk Stash Inventory
description: Audit frozen milk supply. Ensure enough reserve for first week of work.

title: 4-Month Well Visit
description: Schedule checkup: DTaP, Hib, Polio, PCV, Rotavirus doses. Sleep regression discussion.

title: Assess Sleep Regression
description: Research sleep training methods if 4-month regression causes sleep disruption.

title: Stop Swaddling
description: Transition to sleep sack if baby shows signs of rolling over (safety hazard).

title: High Chair Research
description: Research high chairs with footrests and easy-to-clean surfaces.

title: Purchase High Chair
description: Buy chair before solids introduction. Assemble and clean.

title: Solids Readiness Check
description: Check signs: sitting up with support, head control, loss of tongue-thrust reflex.

title: Solids Introduction
description: Begin single-ingredient solids (iron-fortified cereal/puree). Wait 3-5 days between new foods.

title: 6-Month Well Visit
description: Schedule checkup: Vaccines, anemia check, lead screening assessment.

title: Allergen Introduction
description: Introduce peanut/egg protein early (check w/ doctor) to reduce allergy risk.

title: Sippy Cup Introduction
description: Offer water in a sippy/straw cup with meals to practice oral motor skills.

title: Baby Proofing: Mobility
description: Re-evaluate floor safety as baby begins army crawling/scooting.

title: Lower Crib Mattress
description: Lower mattress to middle setting as baby begins pushing up on hands/knees.

title: Object Permanence Games
description: Play peek-a-boo and hide toys to support cognitive development (finding hidden objects).

title: 9-Month Well Visit
description: Schedule checkup: Developmental screening (ASQ), catch-up vaccines.

title: Finger Foods Intro
description: Transition to dissolvable solids (puffs, soft fruit) to practice pincer grasp.

title: Car Seat Adjustment
description: Check harness height (at/below shoulders) and head clearance (1 inch from top).

title: Research Convertible Seat
description: Research rear-facing convertible seats as infant seat limits approach (height/weight).

title: Buy Convertible Seat
description: Purchase next-stage seat. Ensure high rear-facing weight limit (40-50 lbs).

title: First Dentist Visit
description: Schedule "happy visit" upon first tooth eruption or by 1st birthday (AAP guideline).

title: First Birthday Planning
description: Plan celebration. Keep it simple; focus on photos and "smash cake."

title: 12-Month Well Visit
description: Schedule checkup: MMR, Varicella, Hep A vaccines. Lead/Anemia blood draw.

title: Transition to Cow's Milk
description: Begin mixing formula/breastmilk with whole cow's milk (after 1 year).

title: Wean from Bottle
description: Aim to discontinue bottle use by 12-15 months to prevent dental decay.

title: Walking Shoes Purchase
description: Buy soft-soled, flexible shoes once baby is walking outdoors. Barefoot is best indoors.

title: Vision Screening
description: Ensure formal vision screening is conducted (often photoscreening) at well-visit.

title: Pacifier Weaning
description: Begin limiting pacifier use to sleep times to support speech development.

title: Toy Rotation
description: Rotate toys to maintain interest and reduce clutter. Store outgrown items.

title: Flashlight Test
description: Check eyes in photos for "white reflex" (rare sign of retinoblastoma).

title: Sun Safety
description: Begin using mineral sunscreen (SPF 30+) once baby is >6 months.

title: Flu Vaccine (Seasonal)
description: Schedule annual flu shot (requires 2 doses 1 month apart for first-timers).

title: Set Water Heater Temp
description: Lower water heater thermostat to 120F (49C) to prevent accidental scalding.

title: Smoke/CO Detectors
description: Install/test units on every floor and outside every sleeping area. Check dates.

title: Fire Extinguishers
description: Place extinguishers in kitchen and garage. Verify pressure gauge is in green zone.

title: Poison Control Prep
description: Save 1-800-222-1222 in both phones. Post number on fridge/magnet.

title: Fire Escape Plan
description: Map exit routes from all rooms. Determine exactly who grabs the baby in a fire.

title: CPR/First Aid Class
description: Parents and caregivers take infant-specific refresher course (online or in-person).

title: Anchor Furniture
description: Secure dressers, bookshelves, and TVs to walls using anti-tip straps/brackets.

title: Cover Outlets
description: Install plug covers or sliding safety plates on all accessible electrical sockets.

title: Manage Cords
description: Secure blind cords (cleats) and electrical cords (raceways) out of reach.

title: Cabinet Locks
description: Install locks on cabinets containing chemicals (kitchen/bath) and medicines.

title: Stair Gates
description: Install hardware-mounted gate at top of stairs (pressure gates are unsafe at top).

title: Toilet Lid Locks
description: Install locks to prevent drowning risk and hygiene issues.

title: Appliance Latches
description: Secure oven, dishwasher, and fridge doors if accessible.

title: Corner Guards
description: Apply cushioning to sharp corners of coffee tables/hearths.

title: Remove Crib Mobile
description: Remove mobile when baby can push up on hands/knees to prevent entanglement.

title: Lowest Crib Setting
description: Drop mattress to lowest point when baby pulls to stand.

title: Toy Safety Audit
description: Purge toys with small parts (use toilet paper tube test) or loose batteries.

title: Window Guards/Stops
description: Install stops to prevent windows opening >4 inches (fall prevention).

title: Pool Safety Fence
description: If pool exists, ensure 4-sided isolation fence with self-latching gate is installed.

title: Lead Paint Test
description: If home built pre-1978, test peeling paint or renovation dust for lead.

title: Radon Test
description: Conduct long-term radon test in basement/living areas.

title: Detergent Pod Storage
description: Move laundry pods to high shelf; lock container (high poisoning risk).

title: Unload Firearms
description: Ensure all firearms are unloaded and locked in a safe; ammo stored separately.

title: Car Seat Cleaning
description: Clean car seat per manual (no harsh chemicals on straps). Check for crumbs interfering with buckles.

title: Stroller Maintenance
description: Check tire pressure and lubricate wheels of stroller.

title: Humidifier Cleaning
description: Descale and disinfect humidifier weekly to prevent mold growth.

title: Bath Toy Sanitization
description: Bleach/clean bath toys to prevent mold inside squeeze toys.

title: Check Recalls
description: Search CPSC database for recalls on owned crib, stroller, car seat, and toys.

title: Medicine Cabinet Audit
description: Discard expired infant Tylenol/Motrin. Verify dosing chart for current weight.

title: Emergency Bag Prep
description: Pack "Go Bag" with diapers/formula for unexpected ER trips or evacuations.

title: Research Preschools
description: Identify philosophy (Montessori, Reggio, Play-based) and location/cost.

title: Schedule School Tours
description: Book visits for potential preschools. Ask about ratios, discipline, and turnover.

title: Submit Preschool Apps
description: Submit applications for the following academic year (deadlines often Jan/Feb).

title: Swim Lessons
description: Enroll in water safety/survival swim classes (ISR or traditional).

title: Library Story Time
description: Identify local library schedule for free socialization/literacy events.

title: Music/Gym Class
description: Research toddler activity classes for gross motor skills/socialization.

title: Playdate Scheduling
description: Coordinate social time with other parents. Reciprocate invitations.

title: Passport Application
description: Apply for baby's passport (both parents must appear or notarize consent).

title: Global Entry/TSA Pre
description: Enroll child (requires interview) for travel ease.

title: Potty Readiness Check
description: Assess signs: dry naps, hiding to poop, interest in toilet, communicating urge.

title: Buy Small Potty
description: Purchase floor potty (easier ergonomics for squatting than seat insert).

title: Clear Weekend Schedule
description: Block 3 days for "Oh Crap" Block 1 (naked time) training. No outings.

title: Stock Potty Supplies
description: Buy juice/water (push fluids), cleaning spray, rags, and wine (for parents).

title: Daycare Potty Plan
description: Discuss potty plan with teachers. Supply extra clothes/underwear/wet bag.

title: Night Training Prep
description: Buy waterproof mattress protectors (layer: sheet-protector-sheet-protector).

title: 18-Month Well Visit
description: Schedule checkup: Autism screening (M-CHAT), Hep A, DTaP vaccines.

title: 2-Year Well Visit
description: Schedule checkup: BMI check, lead screen, developmental milestones.

title: Dentist Checkup (2Yr)
description: Schedule 6-month cleaning/exam. Fluoride varnish application.

title: Transition to Bed
description: Convert crib to toddler bed if climbing out (or by age 3).

title: Purchase Toddler Pillow
description: Introduce small pillow/light blanket once in a bed (safe after age 2).

title: Preschool Health Forms
description: Complete immunization/physical forms for school entry.

title: School Supply Shop
description: Buy backpack, lunchbox, indoor shoes per school list.

title: Label Everything
description: Apply waterproof labels to all school clothes/gear.

title: Emergency Contact Update
description: Update school with current work numbers and authorized pickup list.

title: Back-to-School Haircut
description: Schedule haircut before first day photos.

title: Seasonal Gear Swap
description: Check fit of coats/boots/rain gear. Buy next size up.

title: Developmental Activities
description: Research age-appropriate crafts/activities (e.g., threading, sorting).

title: Limit Screen Time
description: Audit apps/shows. Set limits per AAP guidelines (high quality, co-viewing).

title: Rotate Books
description: Refresh book selection from library to encourage reading interest.

title: Behavioral Strategy
description: Agree on discipline/tantrum strategies (e.g., "Time-In," redirection).

title: Dishes/Bottles (PM)
description: Wash/sterilize all bottles; run dishwasher. Reset kitchen for morning.

title: Diaper Pail Empty
description: Empty and replace bag before it overflows/smells.

title: Baby Laundry
description: Wash, fold, put away baby clothes (high turnover). Stain treat.

title: Meal Planning
description: Decide menu for the week; generate grocery list. Check pantry staples.

title: Grocery Execution
description: Execute the grocery run or manage online delivery. Put food away.

title: Trash/Recycling
description: Gather trash from all bins; take to curb. Return bins.

title: Bill Pay/Finance
description: Review accounts; pay utilities/mortgage/medical bills. File receipts.

title: Sunday Sync
description: 15-min meeting to review upcoming week's logistics/pickups.

title: Digital Photo Backup
description: Offload phone photos to cloud/hard drive. Organize into folders.

title: Restock Diapers/Wipes
description: Inventory check; order Amazon/Target subscription.

title: Nail Trimming
description: Clip/file baby's nails while sleeping to prevent scratching.

title: Bath Routine
description: Bathe baby (soap not needed daily, but routine helps sleep).

title: Unicorn Space (Dad)
description: 1 hour of uninterrupted time for hobby/self (no work/chores).

title: Unicorn Space (Mom)
description: 1 hour of uninterrupted time for hobby/self (no work/chores).

title: Relationship Check-in
description: Discuss "State of the Union" - emotional check-in, no logistics allowed.

title: Gift Buying (Family)
description: Track birthdays for extended family; buy/ship gifts.

title: Holiday Planning
description: Plan logistics/meals/travel for upcoming major holiday.

title: Vehicle Maintenance
description: Oil change, tire rotation, car wash. Vacuum car seat crumbs.

title: HVAC Maintenance
description: Replace furnace/AC filters. Check humidifier pads.

title: Declutter/Donation
description: Bag up outgrown clothes/toys; donate or store labeled bins.

title: Smoke Alarm Test
description: Test buttons on all alarms. Vacuum dust from sensors.

title: Gutter Cleaning
description: Clean gutters to prevent water damage (or hire out).

title: Lawn/Yard Care
description: Mow, rake, or manage landscaping service.

title: Tax Prep
description: Gather W2s, 1099s, childcare receipts (Daycare tax ID).

title: Apple Legacy Contact
description: Set up Legacy Contact in Apple ID to allow access to photos if deceased.

title: Google Inactive Acct
description: Configure Google Inactive Account Manager to auto-transfer data.

title: Password Sharing
description: Ensure partner has access to Master Password (1Password/LastPass).

title: Update Emergency Info
description: Review/update emergency contacts on phones and fridge.

title: Date Night Planning
description: Book babysitter and make reservations.

title: Book Babysitter
description: Secure childcare for specific upcoming adult events.

title: Travel Prep
description: Book flights/hotels. Request crib. Pack travel gear.

title: Vacation Hold
description: Stop mail/newspapers. Set thermostat/lights for travel.

title: Medical Bill Audit
description: Review EOBs against bills. Dispute errors. Pay balances.

title: Deep Clean Appliances
description: Run cleaning cycles on dishwasher and washing machine.

title: Defrost Freezer
description: Organize freezer, check dates on breast milk/food.

title: Pet Vet Visits
description: Schedule annual vaccinations and checkups for pets.

title: Review Subscriptions
description: Audit streaming/app subscriptions. Cancel unused services.

title: Holiday Cards
description: Organize family photo, order cards, update address list.

title: Halloween Costumes
description: Plan/buy costumes before popular sizes sell out.

title: Birthday Party Prep
description: Book venue, order cake, send invites.
